results.title: Berfunkle
results.creator_credit: Bill Murray, Stu Knickerbocker and Portafilms
results.brief_description: Introduces the problems involved in communication; in use of words as symbols of things and concepts. This animated film considers the problems of verbal communication as it follows the humorous misadventures of a poor soul trying to find the exact meaning of the word “Berfunkle”.

results.title: Benjamin Franklin
results.brief_description: Covers Franklin’s youth, commercial success, experiences in London, and his political career, culminating in his Presidency of the United States of America. No other credits available.

results.title: Benjamin
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Robin Bates and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
This is the story of the first six months of the life of Benjamin Pile, whose entry into the world on November 22, 1974 was filmed by a ‘Horizon’ team, who then recorded his growth and development in the weeks that followed.

results.title: Benedictus
results.brief_description: A mood film which attempts to convey the passage of human life. Simple still nature photography is used to illustrate the theme, with the camera focussing and de-focussing on the subject. A lyrical flute accompaniment gives emphasis to this quiet unassuming film. No other credits available.

results.title: Beneath the dream
results.creator_credit: Peter Pastorelle, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Fuku and Lee are two young Chinese women helping underprivileged youngsters on the island of Hong Kong. One teaches the island’s many working children at a part-time school. The other runs a mobile library (supplied by UNICEF) bringing books, a chance for recreation and learning, to children living along the shores in sampans.

results.title: Beluga baby
results.creator_credit: Tony Westman, Christopher Pinney, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The birth of a beluga whale is a seldom witnessed event. This is a record of the birth of a whale in the Vancouver Aquarium, the excitement building up to it, the labor, and the sudden and inexplicable death of the baby. Awards: Rio de Janeiro; Missoula.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Westman, Christopher Pinney, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Below the high plain
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, Joe Scully, Shan Benson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes the State Electricity Commission’s hydro-electric scheme in north-eastern Victoria as seen by those who live on the job and those who find their recreation in this playground area of the ‘Australian Alps’. Set against a background of mountains, rivers and picturesque reservoirs in the mountain valleys, it is a documentary with a strong human element, describing in non-technical language the construction and operation of this major electricity undertaking. The film shows the alpine region in summer and winter, and the wide range of sport and natural attractions it offers the tourist.

results.title: Belonging: rituals of friendship and association in an Australian country town
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: About social interaction in a small New South Wales country town. Through the lives of four men the film reveals how newcomers to a community create a network of friends and acquaintances which gives them a sense of belonging. Records discussions in various clubs and associations, and suggests that in country towns there are clearly those who “belong” and those who don’t; women, aboriginals, the poor, the unemployed.

results.title: A Bell for Ursli
results.brief_description: This live action film takes place in the Canton of Grisons in Switzerland and illustrates an old custom; when spring comes the village boys chase away the winter with bells, rattles and cracking whips. Ursli, unhappy with his tiny bell, remembers a big bell in his father’s chalet high above the timber-line and sets off to get it.
